title: Judge drops assault charge against former City Hall staffer
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A Boston judge dropped a domestic violence charge against Chulan Huang after the victim did not testify.
The charge stemmed from a domestic incident involving Huang and his then-girlfriend, Marwa Khudaynazar, both former city employees.
The case involved allegations against Segun Idowu, a city leader, but an investigation found no policy violations.

title: This Rowley inn is the perfect place for romance
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Briar Barn Inn in Rowley is highlighted as an ideal Valentine's Day getaway by The Hotel Guru.
JetBlue and Delta Air Lines are ranked among the safest airlines for 2026 by AirlineRatings.com.
Boston's Frostival features a Ferris wheel on the Rose Kennedy Greenway, running through March 1.

title: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space led to a stabbing in Dorchester, police say
author: John Waller
bullets: A dispute over a shoveled-out parking space led to a stabbing on Evans St. in Dorchester.
A 41-year-old man and a 47-year-old woman suffered hand injuries; both were hospitalized.
Enel Javier, 47, was arrested for assault and battery with a dangerous weapon causing serious injury.

title: Where to watch Super Bowl 2026 in Boston: 7 must-visit sports bars
author: Kevin Slane and Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Banners Kitchen & Tap offers a 40-foot screen, DJ, bottomless wings, and ticket packages at 80 Causeway St., Boston.
Tony C's and Cask 'n Flagon provide numerous TVs and lively atmospheres for Patriots fans in Somerville and Boston.
PickleBOS combines pickleball with a Super Bowl watch party, offering open play, food, and streaming at 379R Dorchester Ave.

title: Four charged in $1M SNAP, unemployment fraud scheme tied to Leominster restaurant
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Four individuals charged in $1 million fraud scheme involving SNAP and unemployment benefits in Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Stolen identities used to create fraudulent benefit accounts; $440,000 in SNAP benefits and $700,000 in unemployment benefits obtained.
Raul Fernandez Vicioso's restaurant implicated; profits wired to Venezuela, Dominican Republic; fraudulent documents found at his home and restaurant.

title: Local obituary: Jaylin Rainford, 20, Catholic Memorial grad and Bryant University junior
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Jaylin Douglas Rainford, 20, passed away on January 25, 2026. He was a Bryant University junior and Catholic Memorial graduate.
Rainford excelled in soccer and track, inspired by faith to pursue new interests beyond academics in finance.
Services will be held at Cartwright Funeral Home and St. Mary Church in Randolph, with burial at Central Cemetery.

title: Drake Maye says he got Super Bowl schedule advice from a former Patriots rival
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye received advice from Peyton Manning to keep his schedule consistent for the upcoming Super Bowl.
Maye, a Panthers fan, attended Super Bowl 50 where Manning's Broncos defeated the Panthers 24-10 at Levi's Stadium.
The Patriots will face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, with the game set for Sunday at 6:30 p.m.

title: Here’s what to expect these remaining weeks of winter, according to Dave Epstein
author: David Epstein
bullets: New England is experiencing significantly colder temperatures, with Arctic air bringing subzero conditions and extended cold through early February.
The European forecast models suggest a temporary warming trend around the third week of February, with a return to colder-than-average temperatures in March.
Boston recorded above-average snowfall in January; February snow chances remain, though precipitation may stay below average due to dry Arctic conditions.

title: Kayshon Boutte gives a blunt reason for his breakout season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kayshon Boutte credited quarterback Drake Maye for his breakout season with the New England Patriots.
Boutte recorded 551 receiving yards, six touchdowns, and averaged 17 yards per catch despite missing games due to injury.
Boutte leads Patriots receivers in postseason with 147 yards, including a notable touchdown against Derek Stingley Jr.

title: Joe Milton says he felt ‘disrespected’ by Patriots, Jerod Mayo before trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Joe Milton felt disrespected by the Patriots due to limited playing opportunities in his rookie season.
Milton requested a trade and moved from the Patriots to the Cowboys, where he served as Dak Prescott's backup.
Milton expressed frustration over not receiving backup reps, despite his performance in practices and games.
